INDICATOR_NAME: Employment to population ratio, 15+, total (%) (national estimate)
SOURCE_NOTE: Employment to population ratio is the proportion of a country's population that is employed. Employment is defined as persons of working age who, during a short reference period, were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period (i.e. who worked in a job for at least one hour) or not at work due to temporary absence from a job, or to working-time arrangements. Ages 15 and older are generally considered the working-age population.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in December 2019.
